title: How to Make Porcupine Meatballs

steps.headline: Combine the beef, rice, and spices.
steps.description: Place a large mixing bowl in your workspace. Add the ground beef, rice, and spices to the bowl. Use your hands to combine the ingredients, making sure the spices and rice are thoroughly incorporated into the ground beef.

steps.headline: Form the meatballs.
steps.description: Once the ingredients are thoroughly combined, use your hands to shape twelve meatballs. Each meatball should be roughly the size of a golf ball.

steps.headline: Brown the meatballs.
steps.description: Place a large skillet on the stove. Turn the burner to medium-high heat. Add the meatballs to the skillet. Cook the meatballs until they are evenly browned, turning them occasionally as they cook. This will take about 3-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Drain the meatballs.
steps.description: After the meatballs are browned, use a slotted spoon the remove them from the skillet. Place the meatballs on a large plate that is covered with paper towels. Allow the paper towels to absorb any excess oil for a few minutes. Drain any remaining grease from the skillet.

steps.headline: Add the sauce ingredients to the skillet.
steps.description: While the meatballs are draining, add the tomato sauce, one cup (240 mL) water, and Worcestershire sauce to the skillet. Use a wooden spoon to stir the ingredients together until completely combined.

steps.headline: Return the meatballs to the skillet.
steps.description: Once you have combined the sauce ingredients, begin returning the meatballs to the skillet. Use the slotted spoon to gently place each meatball in the skillet. Once you have returned all the meatballs to the skillet, reduce the heat to medium-low.

steps.headline: Cook the meatballs.
steps.description: Place a lid on the skillet. Simmer the meatballs over medium-low heat for about 45 minutes. If the sauce becomes too dry while cooking the meatballs, add a little more water. When the meatballs are done, the rice will be tender and the meat will no longer be pink inside.

steps.headline: Serve the meatballs.
steps.description: Once the meatballs are cooked, turn off the stove. Allow the meatballs to cool for several minutes and then serve them over a bed of steamed white rice, with a side of cauliflower, or by themselves. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius.
steps.description: You will need to make sure your oven is preheated before baking your turkey porcupine meatballs. Before turning on the oven, place the oven rack in the middle slot. Then turn the oven on to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius.

steps.headline: Prepare a baking dish.
steps.description: You will be baking the meatballs in a 2-quart (1900 mL) glass baking dish. If you don’t have a glass dish, you can you a metal baking dish instead. Grease the baking dish with a teaspoon of olive oil and set aside.

steps.headline: Combine the meatball ingredients.
steps.description: Place the ground turkey, instant rice, onion, garlic powder, pepper, salt, and celery salt in a large mixing bowl. Add ½ cup (120 mL) to the mixing bowl. Use your hands to thoroughly combine the ingredients.

steps.headline: Shape the meatballs.
steps.description: Once you have combined the meatball mixture, use your hands to shape it into meatballs. You will want to make each meatball about the same size as a golf ball. After you make each meatball, place it in the prepared baking dish.

steps.headline: Mix the sauce ingredients.
steps.description: After you have shaped the meatballs and placed them in the prepared baking dish, add the tomato sauce, one cup (240 mL) water, and Worcestershire sauce to a mixing bowl. Stir the ingredients together until combined. Pour the sauce over the meatballs.

steps.headline: Bake the meatballs for one hour.
steps.description: Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil. Place the baking dish on the center rack of the oven. Bake the meatballs at 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius for 60 minutes. Remove from oven.

steps.headline: Serve the meatballs.
steps.description: Allow the meatballs to cool for at least five minutes. You can then serve the meatballs by themselves, over steamed white rice, or with a side of cauliflower. Enjoy!

text: Making Stovetop Porcupine Meatballs Combine the beef, rice, and spices. Place a large mixing bowl in your workspace. Add the ground beef, rice, and spices to the bowl. Use your hands to combine the ingredients, making sure the spices and rice are thoroughly incorporated into the ground beef. Form the meatballs. Once the ingredients are thoroughly combined, use your hands to shape twelve meatballs. Each meatball should be roughly the size of a golf ball. Brown the meatballs. Place a large skillet on the stove. Turn the burner to medium-high heat. Add the meatballs to the skillet. Cook the meatballs until they are evenly browned, turning them occasionally as they cook. This will take about 3-4 minutes. Drain the meatballs. After the meatballs are browned, use a slotted spoon the remove them from the skillet. Place the meatballs on a large plate that is covered with paper towels. Allow the paper towels to absorb any excess oil for a few minutes. Drain any remaining grease from the skillet. Add the sauce ingredients to the skillet. While the meatballs are draining, add the tomato sauce, one cup (240 mL) water, and Worcestershire sauce to the skillet. Use a wooden spoon to stir the ingredients together until completely combined. Return the meatballs to the skillet. Once you have combined the sauce ingredients, begin returning the meatballs to the skillet. Use the slotted spoon to gently place each meatball in the skillet. Once you have returned all the meatballs to the skillet, reduce the heat to medium-low. Cook the meatballs. Place a lid on the skillet. Simmer the meatballs over medium-low heat for about 45 minutes. If the sauce becomes too dry while cooking the meatballs, add a little more water. When the meatballs are done, the rice will be tender and the meat will no longer be pink inside. Serve the meatballs. Once the meatballs are cooked, turn off the stove. Allow the meatballs to cool for several minutes and then serve them over a bed of steamed white rice, with a side of cauliflower, or by themselves. Enjoy! Making Baked Turkey Porcupine Meatballs Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius. You will need to make sure your oven is preheated before baking your turkey porcupine meatballs. Before turning on the oven, place the oven rack in the middle slot. Then turn the oven on to 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius. Prepare a baking dish. You will be baking the meatballs in a 2-quart (1900 mL) glass baking dish. If you don’t have a glass dish, you can you a metal baking dish instead. Grease the baking dish with a teaspoon of olive oil and set aside. Combine the meatball ingredients. Place the ground turkey, instant rice, onion, garlic powder, pepper, salt, and celery salt in a large mixing bowl. Add ½ cup (120 mL) to the mixing bowl. Use your hands to thoroughly combine the ingredients. Shape the meatballs. Once you have combined the meatball mixture, use your hands to shape it into meatballs. You will want to make each meatball about the same size as a golf ball. After you make each meatball, place it in the prepared baking dish. Mix the sauce ingredients. After you have shaped the meatballs and placed them in the prepared baking dish, add the tomato sauce, one cup (240 mL) water, and Worcestershire sauce to a mixing bowl. Stir the ingredients together until combined. Pour the sauce over the meatballs. Bake the meatballs for one hour. Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil. Place the baking dish on the center rack of the oven. Bake the meatballs at 375 degrees Fahrenheit or 190 degrees Celsius for 60 minutes. Remove from oven. Serve the meatballs. Allow the meatballs to cool for at least five minutes. You can then serve the meatballs by themselves, over steamed white rice, or with a side of cauliflower. Enjoy!
